Title:What to do if you see error code 011 (Cannot connect to Roku)

Error code: 011
Description: Cannot connect to Roku Software Update Server during initial setup.
Solution: 
- Wait a few minutes and select "Try again"
- Check support.roku.com for any service alerts
- Check network connectivity and reconnect if necessary.

This document provides a solution to the error code 011 (Cannot connect to Roku Software Update Server during initial setup). It suggests waiting a few minutes and selecting "Try again", checking support.roku.com for any service alerts, and checking network connectivity and reconnecting if necessary. This document can answer questions such as what to do if you see error code 011, what to do if you cannot connect to the Roku Software Update Server during initial setup, and how to troubleshoot network connectivity issues.

Title:What to do if your Roku streaming device is unable to update software

Error codes: 001, 002, 003, 004, 005. 

Descriptions: Error encountered during software update process.

Solutions: Wait a few minutes and try again. Check for network connectivity issues such as correct wireless network connection, router functioning properly, and strong enough wireless signal. Restart the Roku device and router. Use Ethernet connection for faster and more reliable connection.

This document provides solutions to troubleshoot software update issues on Roku streaming devices. It covers error codes 001, 002, 003, 004, and 005, which are encountered during the software update process. Solutions include waiting a few minutes and trying again, checking for network connectivity issues, restarting the Roku device and router, and using an Ethernet connection for faster and more reliable connection. 

This document can answer questions such as what to do if a Roku streaming device is unable to update software, what error codes are encountered during the software update process, and what solutions are available to troubleshoot software update issues.

Title:How to check the connection to your home network and the internet

Error codes and their descriptions:
- If a red ‘x’ appears for Wireless connection (or Wired connection if your compatible Roku device is connected to a wired network), your Roku device cannot make a connection to your router. Solution: Return to the Network menu, select Set up connection, and try again to connect your Roku device to your network.
- If a red ‘x’ appears for Internet connection, your Roku device is able to connect to your wireless network, but it is unable to make a connection to the internet. Solution: To test the internet connection at your home, use your computer or a mobile device that is connected to your home network and try accessing a public website such as www.roku.com. If you cannot access the internet this way, contact your ISP and inquire about an outage in your area. If you can access the internet from your computer or mobile device, double-check that you are connecting your Roku device to the correct wireless network. If the problem continues, restart your Roku device and the router.

Note: There are no specific error codes mentioned in the text, but the descriptions and solutions above refer to connectivity issues that may result in a red ‘x’ appearing during the connection check.

This document provides instructions on how to check the connection to a home network and the internet on a Roku device. It explains how to identify if there is an issue with the connection to the router or the internet, and provides solutions for each issue. This document can answer questions about how to check the connection to a home network and the internet on a Roku device, as well as how to identify and resolve any connection issues.

Title:What to do if your Roku Smart Home device is offline or you see error code 90?

Error code 90: "Device is offline." Possible solutions are to check if the device is powered on, inspect the power connection, restart the device, update and restart the app, check device firmware, test Wi-Fi connection, set up the device again, or factory reset the device.

No other error codes are mentioned in the text.

This document provides solutions to the issue of a Roku Smart Home device being offline or displaying error code 90. Possible solutions include checking the power connection, restarting the device, updating and restarting the app, checking device firmware, testing the Wi-Fi connection, setting up the device again, or factory resetting the device. This document can answer questions about what to do if a Roku Smart Home device is offline or displaying error code 90.

Title:How to change Wi-Fi settings on your Roku Smart Home device

Error codes:

1. Error code 90

Error code descriptions:

1. My device is offline or I see error code 90

Solutions:

1. If you have trouble connecting your device to your new Wi-Fi network, refer to "My smart home device is not connecting to the app" and "My device is offline or I see error code 90."
2. To change Wi-Fi settings for your smart home camera or video doorbell, set up each device from the smart home app. You do not need to factory reset the device which removes settings and preferences.
3. To update Wi-Fi settings for your smart home bulb, plug, or light strip, you must first factory reset each device and then set it up again using the smart home app.
4. If you need detailed instructions, refer to the appropriate setup article mentioned in the text.

This document provides instructions on how to change Wi-Fi settings on a Roku Smart Home device. It provides solutions to common errors such as Error Code 90, which occurs when the device is offline or not connecting to the app. The document outlines how to update Wi-Fi settings for different devices, such as cameras, video doorbells, bulbs, plugs, and light strips. It also provides detailed instructions on how to set up each device from the smart home app. 

This document can answer questions such as: How do I change Wi-Fi settings on my Roku Smart Home device? How do I fix Error Code 90? How do I update Wi-Fi settings for my smart home devices? How do I set up each device from the smart home app?

Title:Why can I not change device settings in the Roku Smart Home app?

There are two error codes mentioned in this text:

1. Error code 90: "Device is offline"
Solution: Refer to the other article for troubleshooting connection issues.

2. No specific error code mentioned, but issues saving settings may be caused by low quality internet connection, low power mode, or out of date app on your mobile device.
Solution: Check mobile device connection, power mode, and update the app. If the issue persists, try using another mobile device or advanced troubleshooting steps like setting up or factory resetting the device.

This document provides information about why users may not be able to change device settings in the Roku Smart Home app. It mentions two error codes, Error code 90 and an unspecified error code, and provides solutions for each. Error code 90 is caused by a device being offline, and the solution is to refer to another article for troubleshooting connection issues. The unspecified error code is caused by low quality internet connection, low power mode, or an out of date app on the mobile device, and the solution is to check the mobile device connection, power mode, and update the app. If the issue persists, users can try using another mobile device or advanced troubleshooting steps like setting up or factory resetting the device.

This document can answer questions such as: What are the causes of not being able to change device settings in the Roku Smart Home app? What are the solutions for Error code 90 and the unspecified error code? What are the advanced troubleshooting steps for this issue?

Title:What to do if your Roku Smart Home device is unable to update software

Error codes: 90.
Descriptions:
- "Device is offline (error code 90)".
Solutions: There are several troubleshooting steps, including checking your internet connection, restarting your smart home device, updating your device firmware, setting up your device again, or factory resetting your device. For specific instructions and details, refer to the appropriate section in the article.

This document provides instructions on how to troubleshoot a Roku Smart Home device that is unable to update its software. It outlines steps such as checking the internet connection, restarting the device, updating the firmware, setting up the device again, and factory resetting the device. This document can answer questions such as what to do if the device is offline, how to update the device's software, and how to reset the device.
